## Natural history notes

Greater Southern Whites (Ascia monuste) are sexually dimorphic. Males are white with black forewing apex, while females are white to gray with black forewing apex and cell spot. Males have a white-yellow ventral hindwing, while females have a gray ventral hindwing. They can be found in flight year round. Their primary host plants include Virginia Pepper Grass (Lepidium virginicum) and Saltwort (Batis maritima), along with various others.
